---
category: news
title: "FYI: You can trick image-recog AI into, say, mixing up cats and dogs – by abusing scaling code to poison training data"
excerpt: "The idea being: secretly poison the training data so that the software later makes bad decisions and predictions. This example image, provided by the academics, of a cat has been modified so that when downscaled by an AI framework for training, it turns into a dog, thus muddying the training dataset There have been numerous research projects ..."
